intro: Potamogeton × serrulifer, commonly known as the narrow-leaved pondweed, is a hybrid aquatic plant that exhibits characteristics of both its parent species. It typically grows in shallow freshwater environments, such as ponds and lakes, where it forms dense underwater vegetation. The plant has long, narrow leaves that are often serrated along the edges, contributing to its common name. Its flowers are small and clustered, with both male and female parts present on the same inflorescence. Potamogeton × serrulifer plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various water organisms.
